ARTICLE.TITLE: Riots in Baghdad hindering return of Calgary girl home to her mom, court told
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Article content

Violent civil unrest in Baghdad is hindering efforts to have a Calgary girl returned to her mom, the woman’s lawyer told court Friday.

Lawyer Teresa Reilly, who acts for the mother of Zahraa Al Aazawi, said the girl is trapped inside the city’s “red zone” and Canadian officials won’t go in to get her.

Reilly told Justice David Labrenz the only way Global Affairs Canada can bring the girl home is if family in Baghdad take her to the airport in the Iraqi city, which is in the “green zone.”

Reilly was responding to a request made by Labrenz on Wednesday to determine how soon the 12-year-old can be put on a plane home.

Reilly said because of violent anti-government protests in Iraq, where dozens have been killed and hundreds injured, Canadian officials are unable to reach the girl to take her to the airport and then home.

“The child is in what they call the red zone,” Reilly said of the pre-teen, who was left with family in Iraq by her father when he returned to Canada in April.
